text.content: Light - GTD

text.content: Introduction

rich_text.plain_text: Introduction

text.content: In today's information explosion era, cross-platform multitasking and scattered attention cause anxiety, making it difficult to focus on completing work.

rich_text.plain_text: In today's information explosion era, cross-platform multitasking and scattered attention cause anxiety, making it difficult to focus on completing work.

text.content: The Getting Things Done framework, born in the 1990s, remains valuable today. Its core philosophy is to transfer all tasks and ideas from your mind into a reliable system, preventing forgetfulness while reducing mental load, freeing attention, and focusing on actual execution. By gradually clarifying tasks and focusing on next action items, each task becomes easier to complete.

rich_text.plain_text: The Getting Things Done framework, born in the 1990s, remains valuable today. Its core philosophy is to transfer all tasks and ideas from your mind into a reliable system, preventing forgetfulness while reducing mental load, freeing attention, and focusing on actual execution. By gradually clarifying tasks and focusing on next action items, each task becomes easier to complete.

text.content: We aim to create a task tool within Light that makes it more convenient to collect and manage personal and work tasks, making tasks easier to complete and team collaboration more seamless.

rich_text.plain_text: We aim to create a task tool within Light that makes it more convenient to collect and manage personal and work tasks, making tasks easier to complete and team collaboration more seamless.

text.content: Explorations

rich_text.plain_text: Explorations

text.content: Thinking

rich_text.plain_text: Thinking

text.content: Traditional GTD theory involves complex steps that require maintaining numerous lists if followed precisely. Therefore, we referenced multiple task management methods, focusing on how to flexibly present natural task processes from everyday life in a digital product, rather than forcing users to follow a specific methodology or theory.

rich_text.plain_text: Traditional GTD theory involves complex steps that require maintaining numerous lists if followed precisely. Therefore, we referenced multiple task management methods, focusing on how to flexibly present natural task processes from everyday life in a digital product, rather than forcing users to follow a specific methodology or theory.

text.content: Through researching various task tools on the market and interviewing users with different habits, we discovered some common issues with task management tools:

rich_text.plain_text: Through researching various task tools on the market and interviewing users with different habits, we discovered some common issues with task management tools:

text.content: Most task products (such as Todoist, TickTick) use an input box + list format, offering limited flexibility in recording or breaking down tasks and capturing ideas. They involve numerous interaction details and rely heavily on the "find the button to complete an operation" approach.

rich_text.plain_text: Most task products (such as Todoist, TickTick) use an input box + list format, offering limited flexibility in recording or breaking down tasks and capturing ideas. They involve numerous interaction details and rely heavily on the "find the button to complete an operation" approach.

text.content: Some all-in-one products (like Clickup) attempt to integrate personal tasks, team tasks, and note-taking features, but to support rich functionality, they end up with excessive buttons in the interface, which not only distracts users but also makes it easy for users to get lost in the interface.

rich_text.plain_text: Some all-in-one products (like Clickup) attempt to integrate personal tasks, team tasks, and note-taking features, but to support rich functionality, they end up with excessive buttons in the interface, which not only distracts users but also makes it easy for users to get lost in the interface.

text.content: Goals

rich_text.plain_text: Goals

text.content: The GTD project aims to make tasks easier to complete:

rich_text.plain_text: The GTD project aims to make tasks easier to complete:

text.content: Understand all your to-dos in one place;

rich_text.plain_text: Understand all your to-dos in one place;

text.content: Quickly record tasks as they come to mind in an intuitive way, and focus on completing each task;

rich_text.plain_text: Quickly record tasks as they come to mind in an intuitive way, and focus on completing each task;

text.content: Users can freely choose methods that help complete tasks, such as breaking them down into action items or scheduling specific times;

rich_text.plain_text: Users can freely choose methods that help complete tasks, such as breaking them down into action items or scheduling specific times;

text.content: Conveniently view the context of collaborative team tasks, efficiently produce task results, and achieve seamless status synchronization and communication;

rich_text.plain_text: Conveniently view the context of collaborative team tasks, efficiently produce task results, and achieve seamless status synchronization and communication;

text.content: Use natural and convenient methods to reduce interaction friction outside of truly valuable actions, giving time back to users;

rich_text.plain_text: Use natural and convenient methods to reduce interaction friction outside of truly valuable actions, giving time back to users;

text.content: Solution

rich_text.plain_text: Solution

text.content: "A notebook, a calendar, and a small inbox for collecting external tasks"

rich_text.plain_text: "A notebook, a calendar, and a small inbox for collecting external tasks"

text.content: Collecting Tasks

rich_text.plain_text: Collecting Tasks

text.content: 1. Quickly Capture Tasks

rich_text.plain_text: 1. Quickly Capture Tasks

text.content: In the Task pad, write down to-dos like in a notebook, smoothly and without interruption, avoiding distractions from cards, lists, or other interaction boundaries that might break your flow or consume attention:

rich_text.plain_text: In the Task pad, write down to-dos like in a notebook, smoothly and without interruption, avoiding distractions from cards, lists, or other interaction boundaries that might break your flow or consume attention:

text.content: Press Enter to create a task and continue recording new tasks;

rich_text.plain_text: Press Enter to create a task and continue recording new tasks;

text.content: Tab to indent, breaking complex tasks into actionable subtasks, ensuring tasks can be performed;

rich_text.plain_text: Tab to indent, breaking complex tasks into actionable subtasks, ensuring tasks can be performed;

text.content: 2. Real-time Collection of Team Collaboration Tasks, Reducing Time Waste and Friction from Switching Between Projects

rich_text.plain_text: 2. Real-time Collection of Team Collaboration Tasks, Reducing Time Waste and Friction from Switching Between Projects

text.content: When a new project task is assigned to me in Light's Space, I can immediately see a notification at the Inbox entry in the upper left corner

rich_text.plain_text: When a new project task is assigned to me in Light's Space, I can immediately see a notification at the Inbox entry in the upper left corner

text.content: Click to open the Inbox, view project tasks, or drag them to personal tasks and schedule them

rich_text.plain_text: Click to open the Inbox, view project tasks, or drag them to personal tasks and schedule them

text.content: Tasks synchronized from Space contain location information; clicking them allows you to jump to the corresponding original location to view detailed project information

rich_text.plain_text: Tasks synchronized from Space contain location information; clicking them allows you to jump to the corresponding original location to view detailed project information

text.content: Click on each task card to fully understand the context in the details page

rich_text.plain_text: Click on each task card to fully understand the context in the details page

text.content: 2. Scheduling Tasks

rich_text.plain_text: 2. Scheduling Tasks

text.content: Better ensure task completion by planning task times in advance:

rich_text.plain_text: Better ensure task completion by planning task times in advance:

text.content: Reduce decision fatigue by eliminating the need to think about "what to do next" during execution, avoiding procrastination caused by too many choices; clear time boundaries help reduce distractions and the temptation of multitasking, ensuring important tasks are completed with priority.

rich_text.plain_text: Reduce decision fatigue by eliminating the need to think about "what to do next" during execution, avoiding procrastination caused by too many choices; clear time boundaries help reduce distractions and the temptation of multitasking, ensuring important tasks are completed with priority.

text.content: Time logic design that better fits real task scenarios

rich_text.plain_text: Time logic design that better fits real task scenarios

text.content: Currently, most task products only allow setting a single time for tasks without distinguishing between expected completion time and actual execution time. This works for simple personal tasks, but in work scenarios, many tasks often require multiple time periods to complete, making it difficult to "complete tasks according to plan step by step."

rich_text.plain_text: Currently, most task products only allow setting a single time for tasks without distinguishing between expected completion time and actual execution time. This works for simple personal tasks, but in work scenarios, many tasks often require multiple time periods to complete, making it difficult to "complete tasks according to plan step by step."

text.content: To address this, we support:

rich_text.plain_text: To address this, we support:

text.content: Adding multiple time slots for the same task, making complex work task scheduling more realistic;

rich_text.plain_text: Adding multiple time slots for the same task, making complex work task scheduling more realistic;

text.content: Coarse-grained all-day task planning, allowing tasks to be scheduled for a particular day first, with specific times allocated later for completion;

rich_text.plain_text: Coarse-grained all-day task planning, allowing tasks to be scheduled for a particular day first, with specific times allocated later for completion;

text.content: Setting up recurring tasks;

rich_text.plain_text: Setting up recurring tasks;

text.content: Scheduling Method 1: Drag the task bar to the Calendar to allocate time for the task

rich_text.plain_text: Scheduling Method 1: Drag the task bar to the Calendar to allocate time for the task

text.content: Scheduling Method 2: For users more comfortable with buttons, click the button on the right side of the task bar to schedule, manually select or use fuzzy input to search for times

rich_text.plain_text: Scheduling Method 2: For users more comfortable with buttons, click the button on the right side of the task bar to schedule, manually select or use fuzzy input to search for times

text.content: Adjusting Time Schedules on the Calendar

rich_text.plain_text: Adjusting Time Schedules on the Calendar

text.content: It's normal that tasks can't be 100% completed; users can push unfinished tasks to tomorrow or a future date with one click

rich_text.plain_text: It's normal that tasks can't be 100% completed; users can push unfinished tasks to tomorrow or a future date with one click

rich_text.plain_text: 3. Organizing Tasks

rich_text.plain_text: Quickly adjust task position and hierarchy by dragging

text.content: Use lists to categorize and manage tasks

rich_text.plain_text: Use lists to categorize and manage tasks

text.content: Conceptualize what needs to be done in each scenario, immersively adjust and update, making the task pool more organized;

rich_text.plain_text: Conceptualize what needs to be done in each scenario, immersively adjust and update, making the task pool more organized;

text.content: Choose different colors for different task lists to easily distinguish types on the calendar.

rich_text.plain_text: Choose different colors for different task lists to easily distinguish types on the calendar.

text.content: You can set up hiding tasks completed a period of time ago, focusing only on unfinished tasks for better concentration

rich_text.plain_text: You can set up hiding tasks completed a period of time ago, focusing only on unfinished tasks for better concentration

text.content: 4. Completing Tasks

rich_text.plain_text: 4. Completing Tasks

text.content: Quick Start to Focus

rich_text.plain_text: Quick Start to Focus

text.content: Method 1: Find the task you want to do on the calendar and start focus mode

rich_text.plain_text: Method 1: Find the task you want to do on the calendar and start focus mode

text.content: Method 2: Focus on today's tasks in the Today tab and enable focus with one click

rich_text.plain_text: Method 2: Focus on today's tasks in the Today tab and enable focus with one click

text.content: Focus mode - Enter a dedicated space for the current task

rich_text.plain_text: Focus mode - Enter a dedicated space for the current task

text.content: Gather all action items, related materials, and results for the current task, paired with a Pomodoro timer, allowing users to immersively complete tasks.

rich_text.plain_text: Gather all action items, related materials, and results for the current task, paired with a Pomodoro timer, allowing users to immersively complete tasks.

text.content: *This is only a preliminary solution concept; more features such as time statistics, break timing, global timer display, and package daily management scenarios still need refinement

rich_text.plain_text: *This is only a preliminary solution concept; more features such as time statistics, break timing, global timer display, and package daily management scenarios still need refinement

text.content: 5. Sync Third-party Personal Calendars for a Complete View of Schedules

rich_text.plain_text: 5. Sync Third-party Personal Calendars for a Complete View of Schedules

text.content: Understand all time arrangements in one place, also avoiding time conflicts between task scheduling and other events

rich_text.plain_text: Understand all time arrangements in one place, also avoiding time conflicts between task scheduling and other events

text.content: 6. Some Shortcut Operations

rich_text.plain_text: 6. Some Shortcut Operations

text.content: Use keyboard shortcuts to summon the global command center, quickly complete operations on one or multiple tasks, saving time spent searching among various buttons

text.content: Some Details and Considerations

rich_text.plain_text: Some Details and Considerations

text.content: Conflict Between Freedom, Flexibility, Power, and Out-of-Box Usability

rich_text.plain_text: Conflict Between Freedom, Flexibility, Power, and Out-of-Box Usability

text.content: During the design of hierarchical note input interactions, we accidentally discovered a similar product, Legend. Although powerful and flexible, it has a high barrier to entry:

rich_text.plain_text: During the design of hierarchical note input interactions, we accidentally discovered a similar product, Legend. Although powerful and flexible, it has a high barrier to entry:

text.content: To accommodate flexible organization of projects, tasks, notes, and other information, it provides rich node formats and highly customizable views, which can be difficult for ordinary users to understand conceptually and use;

rich_text.plain_text: To accommodate flexible organization of projects, tasks, notes, and other information, it provides rich node formats and highly customizable views, which can be difficult for ordinary users to understand conceptually and use;

text.content: Lack of default workflow templates makes it easy for users wanting to use the product to get caught up in "tool building" rather than focusing on the core goal of "completing tasks";

rich_text.plain_text: Lack of default workflow templates makes it easy for users wanting to use the product to get caught up in "tool building" rather than focusing on the core goal of "completing tasks";

text.content: To make the product accessible to regular users, we considered the following points:

rich_text.plain_text: To make the product accessible to regular users, we considered the following points:

text.content: Simplify product conceptsUnify the node concept as "task" while retaining only the essential task elements, avoiding decision difficulties for users at the conceptual level;

rich_text.plain_text: Simplify product conceptsUnify the node concept as "task" while retaining only the essential task elements, avoiding decision difficulties for users at the conceptual level;

text.content: Provide easily understandable "starting points"Include ready-to-use templates such as the "Today" view, and more methodology templates like "Kanban view", "Four Quadrants view", etc.;

rich_text.plain_text: Provide easily understandable "starting points"Include ready-to-use templates such as the "Today" view, and more methodology templates like "Kanban view", "Four Quadrants view", etc.;

text.content: Reduce interaction complexityAdopt natural interaction forms such as content recognition during input, drag and drop, etc.;In the future, AI natural language recognition could help ordinary people achieve more efficient personalized configurations;

rich_text.plain_text: Reduce interaction complexityAdopt natural interaction forms such as content recognition during input, drag and drop, etc.;In the future, AI natural language recognition could help ordinary people achieve more efficient personalized configurations;

text.content: Some Unresolved Issues

rich_text.plain_text: Some Unresolved Issues

text.content: In the notebook-style task editor, should completed tasks be displayed?

rich_text.plain_text: In the notebook-style task editor, should completed tasks be displayed?

text.content: If they remain visible, the Taskpad becomes lengthy; if they're hidden or collapsed, context is lost.

rich_text.plain_text: If they remain visible, the Taskpad becomes lengthy; if they're hidden or collapsed, context is lost.

text.content: We used the "hide tasks from n days ago" option to mitigate this effect, hiding relatively unimportant completed tasks, but there seem to be more optimization directions worth exploring;

rich_text.plain_text: We used the "hide tasks from n days ago" option to mitigate this effect, hiding relatively unimportant completed tasks, but there seem to be more optimization directions worth exploring;

text.content: How should task information be updated between Space tasks and Task pad after dragging?

rich_text.plain_text: How should task information be updated between Space tasks and Task pad after dragging?

text.content: For example, when breaking down into multiple tasks, or updating names, due dates, etc. on one side, should it sync to the other side? This may vary by scenario and require rule settings.

rich_text.plain_text: For example, when breaking down into multiple tasks, or updating names, due dates, etc. on one side, should it sync to the other side? This may vary by scenario and require rule settings.

text.content: Results

rich_text.plain_text: Results

text.content: Like its parent project

rich_text.plain_text: Like its parent project

text.content: Light.tt

rich_text.plain_text: Light.tt

text.content: , the GTD project became a beloved task tool among team members after internal testing. However, since the development phase occurred in the latter half of Light's journey, funding difficulties for Light meant GTD was shelved before it could be released externally, which became a regret for all participants.

rich_text.plain_text: , the GTD project became a beloved task tool among team members after internal testing. However, since the development phase occurred in the latter half of Light's journey, funding difficulties for Light meant GTD was shelved before it could be released externally, which became a regret for all participants.

text.content: We believe that in today's world and future where AI technology is flourishing, Getting Things Done can be implemented in simpler, more natural ways.

rich_text.plain_text: We believe that in today's world and future where AI technology is flourishing, Getting Things Done can be implemented in simpler, more natural ways.
